general_feeling: I feel physically uncomfortable due to its weight, I notice other people around me being self-conscious as if they are behaving in front of the camera. I got scrutinizing looks from strangers. I also do not feel like looking like or being myself. I feel being watched and observed by someone else. And I feel like I am performing a duty to my phone as an obligation more than 6 times a day.
challenges: The sensory and glasses are very heavy. It leaves red marks around the nose. And it hurts on the ears which are holding the glasses. The area of the skin which was occluded by the sensor feels unbreathable. My visual field is occluded. And my skin is irritated by the motion sensing straps.
act_impact: Social interactions and social gatherings, going shopping, walking on the street.
beh_adapt: I stopped putting makeup on everyday. I stopped looking at others or strangers in case they think I am observing them with a camera. I try to avoid going outside to avoid strangersz
social: I need to explain to about 38 people this week what am I doing with the glasses, and clarify that I am not wearing a camera.
improvements: I would rather to not have anybody to notice anything strange about the participants' appearance. I found some of the questionnaires a bit repetitive with the 6 questionnaires daily, the messages, the hand filled sheets, trying to gather as much information as possible. Consequentially it interferes with daily activities quite a bit and privacy and flexibility is reduced upon.
